Title: Belmont Stakes won’t boast a Triple Crown winner, but there’s still plenty of drama
Paragraphs: ['Sovereignty trains before the running of the Belmont Stakes horse race in Saratoga Springs, N.Y., Thursday, June 5, 2025. (AP Photo/Seth Wenig)AP', 'On the morning after Sovereignty won the Kentucky Derby, his trainer, Bill Mott checked him out. It had been a grueling race over a muddy track. The trainer discovered a small scrape about six inches along his right front pastern probably when he clipped heels with another mount coming out of the gate.', 'Mott said it was nothing serious, but anything to do with a horse’s legs is serious. He called Pimlico Race Course and scratched the horse out of the Preakness Stakes, the second stage of the Triple Crown.', 'He said they were doing it for the horse’s future. And that set off a strange gnashing of teeth among self-appointed experts, some of whom don’t know a fetlock from a pastern but clearly understand the value of their extra face time on a television screen if they shout loud enough and long enough.', 'Mott said he owed it to his horse. The windbags said he owed it to the public. The know-nothings insisted that Mott had insulted the American public by denying it the possibility of a Triple Crown winner. The horse is owned by Godolphin Stables, which, in turn, is owned by Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, ruler of the ruler of Dubai and Vice President of the United Arab Emirates. Before the Derby, Godolphin was 0-for-12 in the most prestigious race in the Western Hemisphere.', 'Now a pause for a little common sense. Godolphin has never won a Triple Crown. William Mott has never won a Triple Crown. Now listen to Bob Baffert, who has won two Triple Crowns: “The Classics are still the Classics. It’s a battle of the best 3-year-old horses. I know people are disappointed, but I also know Bill Mott would love to win the Triple Crown because every trainer wants to win it. But he knows his horse well, and we have to respect that.”', 'Even for those who do not bet, there is one common ingredient that keeps the emotion alive in all sports for the American public. Every sport but one has a superstar. That means football, baseball, basketball boxing, hockey and anything else that is competitive. America always needs a superstar to love or hate. Just look what Ali and Frazier did for boxing, which had all but slipped from the public interest.', 'That’s probably the reason for this slice of America’s Triple Crown greed. It has no superstar. Don’t blame the horse or the trainer. It’s the money, stupid. Blame the self-serving owners. You can’t have a superstar if he ain’t there. What great horse is not retired after his 3-year old season? He brings in so much more in stud fees.', 'The proof was a wonder horse named Kelso, a maternal grandson of Triple Crown champion Count Fleet. Before he set foot on a track, owner Allaire du Pont had him gelded in hopes of calming him down. Although he was five times Horse of the Year, the one thing he wasn’t was calmed. Nobody can think like a horse but personally I believe the reason he ran so ferociously was that he was pissed off at missing out on the joy of life on a stud farm.', 'But to return to the race that Sovereignty never ran, listen to Michael McCarthy, whose Preakness winner, Journalism, was second in the slop at the Derby.', '“It’s not a simple decision. It’s easy to say the sporting decision is to run in all three and try to win the Triple Crown. It is not meant to be easy. I don’t know the reason behind Mott’s decision, but I can tell you nobody who knows Bill Mott questions it. It’s his horse and his decision.”', 'Ever sinceSovereignty didn’t run in the Preakness, there have been conversations about spreading out the three legs beyond the current gap of two weeks, then three weeks.', 'But even with a freshened Sovereignty set for the Belmont Stakes on Saturday, the railbirds in Saratoga are busy doing what they always do. They are looking for a price to beat him and Journalism, the two big horses.', 'They know Rodriguez, the Wood Memorial Stakes winner who missed the Derby and Preakness with a foot issue, posted a Belmont-worthy workout a few days ago at Santa Anita Park. Hall of Fame trainer Bob Baffert says his speedy colt is a go.', 'Rodriguez, who has yet to perform on the circuit with judicious use of his greatest asset — speed. Here is a horse that could actually steal this race in that fashion. To do that, he will have to come out of the gate like a firecracker and shoot to the front. If he can do that comfortably and is challenged too late, we can have one hell of an upset. He has the most proven speed in the field.', 'This has the elements of a great race. Journalism, because he looks to be the best. Baeza because he is the most improving. But amid the noise about Sovereignty — that Mott was spitting on tradition with his Preakness detour — Mott and his horse are at Saratoga now and they are raising a few eyebrows among the clockers.', 'From Mott comes an ominous message after Sovereignty worked twice at Saratoga.', 'RECOMMENDED', 'As one trainer beats a dead horse, Belmont could turn into a grudge matchJun. 5, 2025, 6:01 a.m.', 'Track & field: 2025 Meet of Champions FAQ, qualifiers and order of eventsJun. 2, 2025, 6:31 a.m.', '“I noticed a change in his demeanor since he got here,” he said. “He is almost a little more aggressive. The Derby did not set him back, He is just getting a little stronger than he was. He was not this strong before the Derby.”', 'There will be no Triple Crown. But as always in any horse race, you pay your money and take your choice.', '', 'If you purchase a product or register for an account through a link on our site, we may receive compensation. Title: Baeza Gets Another Shot at Kentucky Derby Top Two in Belmont Stakes
Paragraphs:
['CLICK HERE TO SUBSCRIBE TO THE TDN FOR FREE!', '', '', 'Home » Archive » Top News » Baeza Gets Another Shot at Kentucky Derby Top Two in Belmont Stakes', 'Updated: June 5, 2025 at 7:57 am', 'Baeza training at the Spa Wednesday morning | Sarah Andrew', 'By Steve Sherack', "SARATOGA SPRINGS, NY — While the rematch between GI Kentucky Derby winner Sovereignty (Into Mischief) and GI Preakness Stakes winner Journalism (Curlin) has received top billing, the camp surrounding the blue-blooded Baeza (McKinzie) sees a slightly different storyline ahead of Saturday's GI Belmont Stakes at Saratoga.", "“They talk about the challenge of the two of them. I think it's more the challenge of the three of us,” said Lee Searing of C R K Stable, who campaigns Baeza in partnership with the colt's breeder Robert Clay of Grandview Equine.", '“This horse can really run.”', '', '', 'Baeza rallied smartly for third at odds of 13-1–beaten 1 3/4 lengths by Sovereignty and just a neck for second by Journalism–after somewhat of an eventful journey on the first Saturday in May.', 'Widest of all in post 19 after drawing in off the also-eligible list, Baeza was bumped and steadied beneath Flavien Prat at a very crucial juncture at the five-sixteenths and came flying home while completely covered in mud to pass the top two shortly after the wire.', 'Baeza was previously a fantastic second to Journalism while making his stakes debut in the GI Santa Anita Derby.', 'Baeza in front past the wire in the Kentucky Derby | Coady Media', "“We only got beat a neck for second, and we didn't have the greatest of trips, either,” Searing said. “We had one of the best riders in the world riding him and he blames himself for the path he took. The stretch he had to move him in and out and he finally got free.”", "C R K Stable (those are the initials of Lee and Susan Searing's three adult children–Christina, Richard and Katherine) has also finished a rallying fourth with GI Runhappy Santa Anita Derby winner Honor A. P. (Honor Code) in the COVID-delayed Kentucky Derby in 2020 and a troubled 13th with Candy Boy (Candy Ride {Arg}) in 2014. Skinner (Curlin) was scratched due to a fever from the 2023 Run for the Roses.", "“When you start going to the racetrack when you're eight years old, which goes back to 70 years ago, you start hearing about the big races, the great jockeys and great horses, and the Kentucky Derby comes right up,” Searing said.", "“Then you go through the years and think, 'Can I ever get a horse good enough to go?' We've had four and we haven't had a clean trip yet. It's a dream to win it. I have some really nice horses for next year and we'll try again. But the focus right now is on Baeza.”", 'And, of course, that pedigree page of his.', 'Hailing from the first crop of McKinzie, Baeza brought $1.2 million to top the third session of the 2023 Keeneland September Yearling sale.', 'Baeza strikes a pose at the Spa | Sarah Andrew', "He can become an unprecedented third American Classic winner for Broodmare of the Year and 'TDN Rising Star' Puca (Big Brown), who has also produced 2023 Kentucky Derby winner Mage (Good Magic) and last year's Belmont Stakes winner Dornoch (Good Magic). Only Better Than Honour has produced back-to-back Belmont winners–Jazil (2006) and Rags to Riches (2007).", 'The 13-year-old Puca, also responsible for a Good Magic colt of 2024 and a Good Magic filly of this year, sold to John Stewart for $2.9 million at the 2023 Keeneland November Sale.', "“The quality of his breeding and the bloodlines that he comes from–I have a partner in Robert Clay that bred him and is sitting on the fact that mare would be the first to have three winners in Triple Crown races,” Searing said. “He's a great man, good partner and fun to be around. We're both gonna root really hard. God, if he gets it done it will be a tremendous feat.”", "The purple-and-yellow colors of C R K Stable (Searing's silks pay homage to the Los Angeles Lakers and the late Kobe Bryant) have been carried by 1,713 starters (according to Equibase stats), including Grade I winners Beyond Brilliant, Express Train and Switch. Just never one at the Spa.", "“I've never run a horse at Saratoga,” said Searing, who will also be represented by 'TDN Rising Star' Justique (Justify) in Friday's GII Bed o' Roses S. “That's an amazing statistic as many good horses as we've had.”", 'Lee Searing | Photos by Z', "Searing, the CEO of Searing Industries, a California- and Wyoming-based, family-run business specializing in manufacturing steel-tubing products, will have another rooting interest of sorts via the aforementioned Honor A. P., who is the sire of Heart of Honor (GB), a 30-1 longshot in the Belmont Stakes. The sophomore sire stands at Lane's End.", 'Baeza is listed as the third choice at 4-1.', "“It's gonna be fun going to Saratoga and it's gonna be fun watching the race,” Searing said. “I think with a good track–seven, eight horses–and a clean trip, it's gonna be a really really good horse race. Title: Half of the horses running in the Belmont Stakes have Ocala/Marion County connections
Paragraphs: ['Four of the eight horses running in the June 7 Belmont Stakes have Ocala/Marion County connections.', '"God willing, he (Journalism) will win the Belmont," said George Isaacs, general manager at Ocala\'s Bridlewood Farm. The farm is one of several owners of the horse.', "Isaacs said he's going to New York to watch the race.", '"Wouldn\'t miss it for the world. That\'s why we wake up in the mornings," he said.', 'Journalism and Sovereignty share a brief history. Isaacs said both horses were together at Bridlewood when they were younger. He said they came to the farm a couple of weeks apart.', 'The farm manager said the horses never worked together. They were paired with other horses during their early training days. Isaacs said the horses showed athleticism and quickly separated themselves from their peers.', '"They were at the top of their class with the way how they train and carry themselves," Isaacs said.', 'Leaving the farm, the horses went their separate ways. Sovereignty went to Hall of Fame trainer Bill Mott and ran in races like the Fountain of Youth and the Florida Derby. He won the Fountain of Youth and was second in the Florida Derby.', 'Journalism traveled west to California to trainer Michael McCarthy, where he competed in races such as the Santa Anita Derby and San Felipe Stakes. He won both.', "Baeza was a $1.2 million purchase at Keeneland's September Yearling Sale by April, Summer and Jeanne Mayberry, from Mayberry Farm in Ocala, according to the Florida Thoroughbred Breeders' and Owners' Associations. The farm was the home of the horse's foundation and early training.", 'In an interview with a Star-Banner reporter, April Mayberry said she and several others selected the horse at the sale. Brought to the farm for his early training, Baeza proved to be a "laid back horse who was willing and easy to train." She refers to him as an intelligent horse.', 'Similar to Journalism, Baeza was shipped to California to trainer John Shirreffs.', '"That was always the plan," Mayberry said about shipping the horse west to Shirreffs, who was at the sale.', 'Baeza was a fast closing third behind Sovereignty and Journalism in the Kentucky Derby. She said if he had won the derby, he probably would have run in the Preakness. But with him not winning, she suspected the plan was to skip the race and enter the Belmont with a fresh horse.', '"I think our choices are very good. It\'s a competitive field," said Mayberry, who\'s going to the race.', 'FTOB officials said the fourth horse with a local connection is Rodriguez, which had his early training at Eddie Woods Training Center in Ocala.', 'Rodriguez was entered in the Kentucky Derby but had to withdraw because of a hoof issue. The same thing happened for the Preakness.', 'Ocala Breeders\' Sales officials said they don\'t have a starter in the Belmont. A spokesperson said OBS has never had one of its graduates win the Belmont. That is "still on our bucket list!" the spokesperson said.', 'In recent years there have been several Belmont Stakes winners with local connections.', "Dornoch won the race in 2024. The horse had his early training at Raul Reyes' Kings Equine in Ocala. One of Dornoch's co-owner is former Major League Baseball player Jayson Werth.", "In 2023, Arcangelo won the prestigious race. The horse was trained by Jena Antonucci of Ocala. Antonucci was the first woman to train a Triple Crown race winner. Arcangelo got his early training at Antonucci's HorseOlogy training grounds at Ocala's GoldMark Farm.", "In 2019, Sir Winston, trained by Ocala's Mark Casse, won the race. Two years earlier, Bridlewood Farm with Eclipse Thoroughbred Partners and Robert V. LaPenta's Tapwrit was the winner.", 'In 2015, Triple Crown winner American Pharoah won the Belmont. The horse, which was the 12th Triple Crown winner, received his formative training from brothers J.B. and Kevin McKathan of Citra.', 'In 2013, Palace Malice won the race. It got its early training from Niall Brennan of Ocala.', 'Post time is 6:50 p.m. June 7. Fox has the broadcast.
